paragraphs.zh-tw: (Whistling) (Whistling ends) Thank you. Thank you very much.
paragraphs.en: （吹口哨）♫ （觀眾掌聲） 謝謝大家！ （觀眾掌聲） 非常感謝大家！

paragraphs.zh-tw: That was whistling. I'm trying to do this in English.
paragraphs.en: 剛剛那是吹口哨。 我試試看以英文來說。

paragraphs.zh-tw: What is a chubby,curly-haired guy from Holland -- why is he whistling? Well actually, I've been whistlingsince the age of four, about four. My dad was always whistlingaround the house, and I just thought that's partof communication in my family.
paragraphs.en: 好一個圓滾滾的，從荷蘭來的捲毛傢伙-- 他為什麼在吹口哨？ 事實上，我從4歲開始吹口哨--大約4歲。 我父親常常在我家四處吹口哨， 而我以爲那是我們家人的溝通方式。

paragraphs.zh-tw: So I whistled along with him. And actually, until I was 34, I always annoyed and irritatedpeople with whistling, because, to be honest, my whistling is a kindof deviant behavior.
paragraphs.en: 所以我也和他一樣地吹口哨。 而且直到我34歲， 我還常常以口哨逗人及煩人。 因為，說真的， 我的吹口哨算是一種不正常的行為。

paragraphs.zh-tw: I whistled alone,I whistled in the classroom, I whistled on bike, I whistled everywhere. And I also whistledat a Christmas Eve party with my family-in-law.
paragraphs.en: 我自顧自的吹口哨，我在教室裡吹口哨， 我騎腳踏車時吹口哨，在任何地方我都可以吹口哨。 而且我也在聖誕節前夕與 我太太娘家的聚會裏吹口哨，

paragraphs.zh-tw: And they had some, in my opinion,terrible Christmas music. And when I hear music that I don't like,I try to make it better.
paragraphs.en: 我想，這讓他們 聖誕節音樂有點糟糕。 而每當我聽到的音樂是我不喜歡的， 我會試著去改良。

paragraphs.zh-tw: So when "Rudolph the Red-NosedReindeer" -- you know it? (Whistling) But it can also sound like this. (Whistling) But during a Christmas party -- at dinner, actually -- it's very annoying.
paragraphs.en: 所以《紅鼻子馴鹿-魯道夫》大家知道這首歌曲嗎？ （吹口哨）♫ 然而它的旋律也可以像這樣。 （吹口哨）♫ 但是在聖誕節的聚會-- 其實是在晚餐時--這會是非常惱人的。

paragraphs.zh-tw: So my sister-in-law asked me a few times,"Please stop whistling." And I just couldn't. And at one point -- and I had some wine,I have to admit that -- at one point I said,"If there was a contest, I would join." And two weeks later, I received a text message:"You're going to America." So, OK, I'm going to America.
paragraphs.en: 所以我的嫂嫂/弟妹 跟我說了幾次：「請不要再吹口哨。」 可我就是停不下來。 在晚餐上--我喝了一些葡萄酒，我得承認這一點-- 在晚餐上我說：「如果有吹口哨的比賽，我一定會去參加。」 在兩個星期後 我收到一個簡訊：「你要出發去美國。」 所以，好，我要出發去美國。 我很願意去，但是為啥呢？

paragraphs.zh-tw: I would love to, but why? So I immediately called her up, of course. She googled, and she foundthis World Whistling Championship in America, of course.
paragraphs.en: 所以我馬上打電話給她，這是一定要的。 她在Google的網站， 發現這場世界吹口哨大賽 在美國，當然了。

paragraphs.zh-tw: She didn't expect me to go there. And I would have lost my face.
paragraphs.en: 她沒有想到我會去。 可我也不能丟自己的臉。

paragraphs.zh-tw: I don't know if that's correct English. But the Dutch people herewill understand what I mean.
paragraphs.en: 我不知道這算不算是正確的英文。 不過如果這裡有荷蘭人一定能明白我的意思。

paragraphs.zh-tw: I lost my face. And she thought, "He will never go there." But actually, I did.
paragraphs.en: 我丟了我的臉。 （觀眾掌聲） 然後她想：「他永遠不可能去那裡。」 不過事實上我做到了。

paragraphs.zh-tw: So I went to Louisburg, North Carolina,southeast of the United States, and I entered the world of whistling. And I also entered the World Championship, and I won there, in 2004.
paragraphs.en: 所以我去了北卡羅萊納州的路易斯堡， 位於美國的東南方， 我走進了吹口哨的世界。 並且參加了世界吹口哨大賽， 我贏得了2004年的冠軍。 （觀眾掌聲）

paragraphs.zh-tw: That was great fun, of course. And to defend my title --like judokas do and sportsmen -- I thought, well let's go back in 2005 -- and I won again.
paragraphs.en: 那真是--- 那真的是非常有趣，當然了。 為了保持我的頭銜-- 各位知道的，跟一般人以及運動員一樣-- 我想，讓我們回到2005年 我又贏了。

paragraphs.zh-tw: Then I couldn't participatefor a few years. And in 2008, I entered againin Japan, Tokyo, and I won again.
paragraphs.en: 之後有幾年我無法參加。 然後在2008年我再次參加 在日本東京，我再次獲勝。

paragraphs.zh-tw: So what happened now is I'm standing here in Rotterdam,in the beautiful city, on a big stage, and I'm talking about whistling. And actually, I earn my moneywhistling, at the moment.
paragraphs.en: 所以現在的情況是這樣 我在鹿特丹港，這美麗的城市，站在一個大型表演台上， 談論吹口哨的話題。 實際上我在吹口哨的同時也賺到了錢。

paragraphs.zh-tw: So I quit my day job as a nurse. And I try to live my dream -- well, actually, it was never my dream,but it sounds so good.
paragraphs.en: 所以我辭掉了護士的工作。 （觀眾掌聲） 而且我試著來實踐我的夢想。 其實，以吹口哨爲生從來不是我的夢想，但這聽起來很棒。 （觀眾掌聲）

paragraphs.zh-tw: OK, I'm not the only one whistling here. You say, "Huh, what do you mean?" Well actually, you are goingto whistle along.
paragraphs.en: 好，我不是這裡唯一會吹口哨的人。 你會說：「啥！你什麼意思？」 事實上，你們也要一起吹口哨。

paragraphs.zh-tw: And then always the same thing happens: people are watching each otherand think, "Oh, my God. Why? Can I go away?" No, you can't.
paragraphs.en: 然後相同的事情又會再發生： 人們會彼此對望然後想：「噢，天啊！ 為什麼？我可以開溜嗎？」 不行，你不可以。 其實這很簡單。

paragraphs.zh-tw: Actually, it's very simple. The track that I will whistleis called "Fête de la Belle." It's about 80 minutes long.
paragraphs.en: 我接下來要吹的 曲名是"Fête de la Belle." 時間大約 80分鐘。

paragraphs.zh-tw: No, no, no. It's four minutes long. And I want to first rehearsewith you your whistling.
paragraphs.en: 不，不，不。只有4分鐘。 首先我想先和大家演練一下你們的哨音。

paragraphs.zh-tw: Yes, so I whistle the tone. (Whistling) Sorry, I forgot one thing -- you whistle the same tone as me.
paragraphs.en: 所以我吹出音調。 （吹口哨）♫ 抱歉，我忘記一件事。 你們哨音的音調要和我一樣。

paragraphs.zh-tw: I heard a wide variety of tones. (Geert Chatrou and audience whistling) (Whistling ends) This is very promising.
paragraphs.en: 我聽到變化多端的音調。 （吹口哨）♫ 這聼起來很不錯。

paragraphs.zh-tw: This is very promising. I'll ask the techniciansto start the music.
paragraphs.en: 聼起來很不錯。 我來請技術人員開啟音樂。

paragraphs.zh-tw: And if it's started,I just point where you whistle along, and we will see what happens. Oh, I'm so sorry, technicians.
paragraphs.en: 一旦開始，要大家一起吹的時候，我會給你們暗示 然後我們再看看如何。 喔，阿哈！ 我很抱歉，技術員。

paragraphs.zh-tw: I'm so used to that. I start it myself.
paragraphs.en: 我已經很習慣了。 我自己來開啟好了。

paragraphs.zh-tw: OK, here it is. (Music) (Whistling) (Whistling ends) (Music) OK.
paragraphs.en: 好，音樂來了。 （音樂） （吹口哨）♫ 好。

paragraphs.zh-tw: (Whistling) It's easy, isn't it? (Whistling) Now comes the solo,I propose I do that myself, OK? (Music) (Whistling) Max Westerman: Geert Chatrou,the World Champion of Whistling. Geert Chatrou: Thank you. Thank you.
paragraphs.en: （吹口哨）♫ 很簡單，對吧。 （吹口哨）♫ 接下來是獨唱，我建議我一個人吹就好了。 （吹口哨）♫ （觀眾掌聲） Max Westerman：Geert Chatrou，世界吹口哨冠軍。 Geert Chatrou：謝謝大家！謝謝大家！

title: A Whistleblower You Haven T Heard
